title: Gen5 2015 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This big soft wine smells and tastes a little sweet, as an aroma like maple syrup leads to flavors of blackberry jam, cinnamon and butter.

title: Concha y Toro 2016 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: Neutral white-fruit aromas are slightly oxidized. This Chardonnay feels chunky and creamy, with only moderate acidity. Sweet-leaning flavors suggest canned pineapple, while this feels syrupy and tastes like papaya on a soft finish.

title: Cono Sur 2015 Bicicleta Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Leathery plum and berry aromas are also jammy and floral on this full and round wine. Roasted berry flavors come with a bacon-like note, delivering similar flavors on the finish.

title: Apex 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Enchanting apricot and spice aromas are followed by full-bodied, creamy fruit flavors that provide intrigue but lack depth. Overall, it's a bit ponderous and short on the finish.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Bellisimo Vermentino (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This wine is sweet and syrupy, smelling like honeydew melon and bananas, and tasting a bit like peach nectar. It could be good after dinner with cheeses or a not-so-sweet dessert.

title: Cantina di Sorbara NV Dedicato ad Alfredo Molinari  (Lambrusco Salamino di Santa Croce)
description: Fun and refreshing, this deep-hued, informal wine has ripe red grape and raisin hints. The aromas follow through to the zesty, frothy palate, along with dried cherry and blackberry notes. It's easy-drinking and enjoyable, with a dry, tangy finish.

title: Domaine de la Prébende 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)
description: This crisp wine brings out good flavor depth from the cherry and red-berry fruits. It is concentrated for a simple Beaujolais, ripe and fruity, Drink now.

title: Château de Lavernette 2015 Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)
description: This highly perfumed wine comes from a small Gamay appellation that is in fact in the Mâcon region. With some tight tannins and rich black fruits, it is a ripe, juicy wine that has intense acidity as well as a spicy aftertaste. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.

title: Château de Lavernette 2016 Château de Lavernette  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this soft, fruity wine is full of red-cherry fruits. It also offers a touch of banana flavor as well as acidity and a bright, crisp juicy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château La Greffière 2016  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine
description: This attractive wine offers lemon and sliced-apple fruitiness. It has a lively character, crisp, tangy and ready to drink.

title: Bistro 2016 Signature Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: Notes of peach, green melon and white cherry are accented by hints of carnation and talc. The palate is light and lively, with citrus peel and melon rind flavors that carry through to the close.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2015 Joven Syrah-Grenache (Somontano)
description: Savory, gritty raspberry and currant aromas are earthy, with a suggestion of Band-Aid. This Syrah-Garnacha blend feels rubbery and tannic, with a downward pull. Roasted red-berry and plum flavors finish with a note of grilled meat.

title: Bonair 2016 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's generous aromas suggest roasted corn and apple. It's medium bodied, with appealing yet straightforward flavors, finishing tart.

title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)
description: This soft wine, full of ripe apricots and melons, summarizes this rich white-wine vintage. It is creamy, laced with just enough acidity and fruity. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2016 Sur la Roche  (Mâcon-Vergisson)
description: This is a soft wine, with simple, ripe fruit flavors. It has weight, pear and melon flavors and an attractive, juicy zesty aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

title: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas like black pepper, anise and grilled meat lead to nicely tart flavors and a mildly tannic mouthfeel. This spicy-tasting wine is relatively light bodied but has plenty of interesting flavors to explore.

title: Hervé Kerlann 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine is tight, with layers of yellow fruit and spice that are masked by wood flavors. Drink from 2018.

title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Pierres Dorées  (Coteaux Bourguignons)
description: Pure Pinot Noir from the south of Beaujolais, this is soft, fruity and with attractive acidity. Red fruits and a crisp acidity give this wine its bright character. Ready to drink now.

title: Mont Marçal NV Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lean aromas of green fruits include notes of grass and vanilla. This feels about average, with some flatness to the palate. Dry, slightly bitter flavors of green fruits and arugula end with briny citrus.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2015  Saint-Véran
description: This wine is crisp, tangy and bright with acidity. With a lively touch of vanilla and spice over the crisp fruitiness, it is developing well. Drink from 2018.

title: Pasquale Pelissero 2014 San Giuliano  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with French oak and toasted hazelnut aromas. The lean, assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean and licorice flavors alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Fortant 2014 Mountains Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)
description: Peach and yellow apple aromas lead the nose, with sweet orange oil and fresh honeydew adding depth and character. There's ample acidic lift to the palate, keeping the mouthfeel bright and the finish clean. A hint of peach pit accents the close.

title: Porta 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)
description: Peppery, raw aromas sport dry red-fruit notes. This is good in a modest, easy way. Simple, lightweight plum and currant flavors finish lean and snappy.

title: Portia 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This young, oaky Tinto Fino opens with charred aromas, but soon scents transition to cheesy and chocolaty. This wine is bullish in texture, with a ton of oak-driven clove, spice and burnt flavors. For the most part, fruit is not a big factor, as the “roble” in this wine drives the car.

title: Fulkerson 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Subtle green tones of fresh herb, lime and apple persist from nose to finish on this dry, medium-bodied Riesling. It's earthy and herbaceous but quite elegant. Zippy acidity carries a pristine, refreshing finish.

title: Fulkerson 2016 Juicy Sweet Estate Diamond (Finger Lakes)
description: Candied peach, melon and grape notes are sweet and simple in this fruity white wine. Made from Diamond, a Concord-grape hybrid, with just a splash of Riesling, it's forward and easy but finishes with a crush of sweet-tart citrus. Drink now.

title: Laroche 2016 La Chevalière Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)
description: Scents of yellow apple, white peach and ripe melon continue through to the medium-weight palate. A touch round, though not quite flat, this is a touch straightforward, but certainly pleasant and enjoyable. Drink now.

title: Left Bend 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a good array of purple-flower aromas, including lavender and potpourri, on the nose of this bottling, as well as light cola and plum skins. The sip is quite bitter and tarry though, with just a touch of riper black fruit.

title: McGregor 2016 Muskat Ottonel (Finger Lakes)
description: The nose on this dry, aromatic wine is buoyantly peachy, accented by hints of sweet pineapple and guava. The palate is fresh and fruity as well, but less concentrated. Light bodied and brisk, it finishes with a touch of bitterness.

title: Lander-Jenkins 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: A strong oak aroma and a rather dense chewy texture make this wine a bit of a show-off, while spicy oaky flavors dominate the fruit component. It has definite tannins and a touch of astringency on the finish.
